notes.text: This CSAF advisory was extracted from unstructured data and may contain inaccuracies. If you notice any errors, please reach out to the designated contact at CISA CSAF: central@cisa.dhs.gov
notes.title: CISA Disclaimer

notes.title: Legal Notice

notes.text: Successful exploitation of this vulnerability could allow an attacker to cause memory corruption issues resulting in unwanted behavior such as code execution.
notes.title: Risk evaluation

notes.text: CISA reminds organizations to perform proper impact analysis and risk assessment prior to deploying defensive measures.
notes.title: Recommended Practices

notes.text: CISA also provides a section for control systems security recommended practices on the ICS webpage on cisa.gov/ics. Several CISA products detailing cyber defense best practices are available for reading and download, including Improving Industrial Control Systems Cybersecurity with Defense-in-Depth Strategies.
notes.title: Recommended Practices

notes.text: CISA encourages organizations to implement recommended cybersecurity strategies for proactive defense of ICS assets.
notes.title: Recommended Practices

notes.text: Additional mitigation guidance and recommended practices are publicly available on the ICS webpage at cisa.gov/ics in the technical information paper, ICS-TIP-12-146-01B--Targeted Cyber Intrusion Detection and Mitigation Strategies.
notes.title: Recommended Practices

notes.text: Organizations observing suspected malicious activity should follow established internal procedures and report findings to CISA for tracking and correlation against other incidents.
notes.title: Recommended Practices

notes.text: No known public exploits specifically target this vulnerability. This vulnerability is not exploitable remotely.
notes.title: Recommended Practices

notes.text: All versions of GE Digital CIMPLICITY that are not adhering to SDG guidance and accepting documents from untrusted sources are vulnerable to memory corruption issues due to insufficient input validation, including issues such as out-of-bounds reads and writes, use-after-free, stack-based buffer overflows, uninitialized pointers, and a heap-based buffer overflow. Successful exploitation could allow an attacker to execute arbitrary code.
notes.title: Vulnerability Summary

remediations.details: To obtain the latest versions of GE CIMPLICITY, contact your local GE Digital representative at https://digitalsupport.ge.com/s/contactsupport.

Exploit is only possible if an authenticated user with local access to the system obtains and opens a document from a malicious source so secure deployment and strong access management by users is essential. GE Digital and customers have a shared responsibility for security and users are required to adhere to the most recent Secure Deployment Guide (SDG) instructions.
Please refer to GE Digital's security bulletin for more information.
